dt: {bc}an attitude or expression of mocking irreverence and sarcasm

dt.t: … no human endeavor is beyond {wi}snark{/wi} these days, so lots of people enjoy hijacking a corporation's marketing hashtag to mock the company …

shortdef: an attitude or expression of mocking irreverence and sarcasm

dt: {bc}to make an irreverent or sarcastic comment {bc}to say something {d_link|snarky|snarky}

dt.t: Are they even willing to discuss policy rather than {wi}snark{/wi} about candidates' supposed personality flaws?
[Chrissy] Teigen said she was in the process of privately reaching out to people she had insulted in the past. She said she first started using social media to "{wi}snark{/wi} at some celebrities."
Tina Fey has embodied that all-too-rare brainy/funny/sexy trifecta since she first {wi}snarked{/wi} her way through Saturday Night Live's "Weekend Update."
Upon gazing at the evening meal, Russell {wi}snarked{/wi}: "Is this a nursery school picnic?"

shortdef: to make an irreverent or sarcastic comment : to say something snarky
